intro: Maytenus rhamnoides, commonly known as the Mexican privet, is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its opposite, simple, and usually elliptic or ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in axillary inflorescences, followed by small, yellowish berries. Maytenus rhamnoides is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and tolerance to various soil conditions. It is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
